result.execSummary:
Jerry L Facon was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Jerry L Facon was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry L Facon

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Cases 21CF614 & 22CF79 called at 8:32 AM 
Defendant Jerry L Facon not in court.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 22CF79: The Court notes that Mr. Facon was extradited on Wednesday; case is to remain closed; no further action taken.

ADA Beck requests 21CF614 be schedueld for status in Branch 1.

recess: 8:34am 
NEXT: As to Case 21CF614, Status on 4/5/22 at 9:30am

Extradition Commitment Warrant

ec/pc: DA, Jail, Governors Office (2/14/22--ma)
Copy of Waiver of Extradition received from JESO
Status conference on March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 1:39PM
Defendant Jerry L Facon appears in court, in custody. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Defendant advises that he wishes to waive extradition and proceed with matters in Arkansas.
The Defendant advises that he has a vision problem that prevents him from reading the waiver. The Court reads aloud the waiver form for the Defendant.

The Court finds that the waivers are in proper form, and executed by the Defendant in court today.

The Court sets this matter over for a Status Conference. The Court notes that it has scheduled this hearing out for 30 days for review. If the Defendant is no longer in custody with Jefferson County at that time, the hearing will fall off the Court's calendar.

recess 1:48PM

NEXT: Status Conference on 03/11 at 8:30AM (may fall off if Def is extradited)

[ma] Case called at 1:40 PM 
Defendant Jerry L Facon appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.

Mr. Facon is not contesting extradition

The Court orders Mr. Facon held without bond, for 30 days, pending extradition.

The Court administratively transfers this case to Branch 3, and will schedule hearing for tomorrow at 1:15pm 
recess 1:46 pm. 

NEXT: Extradition Hearing on 2/10/22 at 1:15pm (Waiver)
